SEARCH
Module it.polimi.ingsw
Package it.polimi.ingsw.server.Model

Class Model

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.server.Model.Model
All Implemented Interfaces:
TimerInterface
public class Model extends Object implements TimerInterface

Class used to control the evolution of the game.

It holds and manages all the information about a single game:

  • board;
  • bookshelves;
  • players (and their points);
  • chat logs;
  • etc.

The model's public methods allow the players to modify the state of game by:

  • removing tiles from the board;
  • changing the order of the selected tiles;
  • adding the tiles to their bookshelves.

The model also manages the turns. When a player adds a tile to his bookshelf the game advances to the next turn since it is the last move a player can do during his turn.

The model selects the next non-disconnected player in line; if there is only one player left it selects the first disconnected player it finds to stop the game and wait for at least another player to reconnect or it will end the game after 2 minutes.

The model also notifies the virtual views of each player with the necessary information for the client such as the points, the state of the board, the bookshelves, and the current player.

  • Constructor Details

    • Model

      public Model()
      Main constructor for the model.

  • Method Details

    • initialization

      public void initialization()

      Method to initialize the board and the objectives:

      create and initialize the board,initialize common and personal objectives, add the views as change listeners,initialize the arrays of points.

    • removeTileArray

      public void removeTileArray(Player player, ArrayList<Point> points) throws MoveNotPossible

      Method to remove an array of tiles from the board if the move is legitimate.

      Also notifies the views of changes.
      Parameters:
      player - The username of the player who wants to remove the tile.
      points - The position of the tiles.
      Throws:
      MoveNotPossible - if the game is not in the right state.
      NotCurrentPlayer - if the player is not the current player.
      IllegalArgumentException - if the array points is null.
      TooManySelected - if the array points is too long.
      TilesNotAdjacent - if the tiles are not adjacent.
      OutOfDomain - if at least one of the points is outside the board.
      TilesCannotBeSelected - if at least one of the selected tiles is either Empty or Not Allowed.

    • addToBookShelf

      public void addToBookShelf(Player player, int column) throws MoveNotPossible

      Method to add the selected tiles in the player's bookshelf.

      Since adding tiles to your bookshelf is the last action you can do on your turn, it also makes the game go to the next turn.
      Parameters:
      player - The player who owns the Bookshelf.
      column - The column where you want to add the tiles.
      Throws:
      OutOfDomain - if requested column does not exists.
      ColumnIsFull - if the requested column is full.
      MoveNotPossible - if game is not in the right state.
      NotCurrentPlayer - if the player requesting the move is not the current player.

    • swapOrder

      public void swapOrder(ArrayList<Integer> ints, Player player) throws MoveNotPossible, IllegalArgumentException

      Method to swap the order of the array of selected tiles to the order describes in the array ints.

      ex. oldSelectedTiles[G,B,Y], ints[2,1,3] --> newSelectedTiles[B,G,Y].
      Parameters:
      ints - The new order of the array.
      player - The player requesting the move.
      Throws:
      MoveNotPossible - The game is not in the right state.
      NotCurrentPlayer - The player is not the current player.
      IllegalArgumentException - The ints array is not of appropriate content.
      TooManySelected - if the array is not of appropriate size.

    • disconnectPlayer

      public void disconnectPlayer(Player player, VirtualView view)

      Method to disconnect the selected player.

      If there is only one player left starts the end timer.
      Parameters:
      player - The player to disconnect.
      view - The virtual view of the player.

    • playerReconnection

      public void playerReconnection(Player player, VirtualView view)

      Method to reconnect the selected player.

      If the game was stopped due to and insufficient number of players, checks if there are enough players and if so makes the game continue.
      Parameters:
      player - The player to reconnect.
      view - Virtual view of the player.

    • sendMessage

      public void sendMessage(String playerForwarding, String message)
      Method that forwards a message coming from the chat to all the players.
      Parameters:
      playerForwarding - the player that sent the message.
      message - the message to forward.

    • sendMessage

      public void sendMessage(String forwardingPlayer, String message, String receivingPlayer)
      Method that forwards a message coming from a private chat to a particular player.
      Parameters:
      forwardingPlayer - the player that sent the message.
      message - the message to forward.
      receivingPlayer - the player that receives the message.
